In such a case, the player cannot clearly know about the item 72 in the distance. FIGS. 14A and 14B show images generated when the present invention is applied to a role-playing game. In FIGS. 14A and 14B, the first displayed object is a character 70 coming on the game while the second object is an item 72 to be acquired by the character 70. When the distance between the character 70 and the item 72 is relatively short, the angle of view is relatively large as shown in FIG. 14A. If the distance is relatively long, the angle of view is relatively small as shown in FIG. 14B. In FIG. 14A, thus, the player can more clearly grasp information around the character 70 controlled by the player. In FIG. 14B, the player can clearly know about the item 72 in the distance.
